resources.string: Rights are things that everyone should have or be able to do. They are like special protections that help you live a happy and healthy life. Here are some examples of rights you have:
Right to Be Safe: You have the right to live in a safe place where you are protected from harm.
Right to Education: You have the right to go to school and learn.
Right to Speak: You have the right to express your thoughts and opinions.
Right to Play: You have the right to play and have fun.
This is content inside the card
Responsibilities are things you are expected to do. They help you and others around you live well together. Here are some examples of responsibilities you might have:
To Listen: You should listen to your parents, teachers, and other adults.
Do Your Chores: You should help with tasks at home, like cleaning your room or setting the table.
Be Kind: You should treat others with kindness and respect.
To Study: You should do your homework and try your best in school.
